alert.note: Alert for Butler (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 9:01PM EDT until June 14 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest Ohio, including the following county, Butler. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 901 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Mason, Oxford, Monroe, Trenton, Franklin, South Middletown, West Chester, Ross, Seven Mile, Williamsdale, Darrtown, Olde West Chester, Wetherington, Four Bridges, Reily, New Miami and Millville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
